Articles.Content:
I've been using Community Tech Tree because most of my part mods support it. The other tech trees support my mods, but they choose part placement instead of the mod author. Just curious what others are using (and why).

I left off mods like SETI Balance and Better Than Starting Manned since they alter more than just the tech tree. They would fall under "Something else".

Edited March 4, 2015 by TCFirebird

Hello,

My TREE isnt necessarily MOD-Oriented, but since my KSP game is MODDED, it might as well be.

I use the STOCK TREE for the most part and have not added any NODES; Keep It Simple as possible is my thinking altho I have increased my Science requirements by triple or more to get into a NODE. I have had to move almost EVERY MOD part; I use v24 (no DLLs only parts) to move them all LOL then port the TREE into v90; I am probly the only person doing it; and even still it takes me a few days).

Cmdr Zeta

CTT here, though to be fair, I haven't tried AIDOS or a more mod oriented tech tree like I've heard KSP interstellar has. A few of my mods do add a few higher tier parts to the tech tree, but nothing like what I've heard KSP interstellar is supposed to be like.
Just to be clear, "Mod-Oriented Tech Tree" is it's own mod and doesn't just mean that your tech tree is built around mods.
